comment.author: 82609930@N06
comment._content: This is Carol M. Highsmith. I am documenting America so that my images can be donated copyright-free to the Library of Congress. See my Web site: www.CarolHighsmithAmerica.com. I feel that aerial photography is important because it is a time stamp. I have flown by helicopter over Washington, D.C. for years. One cannot hire a helicopter to fly over the city, you need to go through a government agency. I was doing some aerial work for the National Park Service and I was able to look down on the entire Library of Congress complex. I have a gyroscope so that the images are sharp. I was thrilled to be able to show the Thomas Jefferson building from a unique perspective.

comment.author: 37408767@N03
comment._content:
I have never seen it like that
Great view and great building

comment.author: 8652182@N06
comment._content: One of my favorite places!  I could spend days in there looking at all the art.
